means: 使稳( steady的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Lovelock eased back the throttles and the ship steadied.
sentence.Network_cn: 洛夫洛克慢慢地拉杆减速，船稳了下来。

sentence.Network_en: Somehow she steadied herself and murmured, "Have you got a cigarette?"
sentence.Network_cn: 她设法让自己镇定下来，并小声问：“你有烟吗？”

sentence.Network_en: Chin steadied herself with one hand on the desk.
sentence.Network_cn: 琴向后退了两三步,一只手撑在写字台上面,一只手摸着额角,身子就靠着写字台.

The boat soon steadied again ., 那船很快又稳定了下来.
The market steadied after a week ' s fluctuation ., 经一周波动之后 , 市场情况趋于稳定.

entry.def: A steady situation continues or develops gradually without any interruptions and is not likely to change quickly.

example.ex: Despite the steady progress of building work, the campaign against it is still going strong...
example.tran: 尽管建筑施工已在稳步进行，但反对活动仍然高涨。

example.ex: The improvement in standards has been steady and persistent, but has attracted little comment from educationalists...
example.tran: 标准一直在持续提高，但却几乎没有教育学家对此发表意见。

entry.tran: 稳定的;牢固的;不摇晃的
entry.def: If an object is steady, it is firm and does not shake or move about.

example.ex: Get as close to the subject as you can and hold the camera steady...
example.tran: 尽量靠近拍摄对象，拿稳相机。

example.ex: It takes a very steady hand and plenty of practice to paint a perfect line.
example.tran: 只有手不发抖并多加练习才能画出完美的线条。

entry.def: If you look at someone or speak to them in a steady way, you look or speak in a calm, controlled way.

example.ex: 'Well, go on,' said Camilla, her voice fairly steady...
example.tran: “好吧，请继续，”卡米拉用很沉着的语气说道。

example.ex: Gail was silent for a moment, regarding Harry with his steady gaze.
example.tran: 盖尔镇定地注视着哈里，沉默了片刻。

entry.def: If you describe a person as steady, you mean that they are sensible and reliable.

example.ex: He was firm and steady unlike other men she knew.
example.tran: 他坚定可靠，和她认识的其他男人不一样。

example.ex: ...a politician who's steady almost to the point of being boring.
example.tran: 理智得近乎乏味的政治家

entry.def: If you steady something or if it steadies, it stops shaking or moving about.

example.ex: Two men were on the bridge-deck, steadying a ladder...
example.tran: 两名男子在船桥甲板上扶着一架梯子不让它摇晃。

example.ex: Lovelock eased back the throttles and the ship steadied.
example.tran: 洛夫洛克慢慢地拉杆减速，船稳了下来。

entry.def: If you steady yourself, you control your voice or expression, so that people will think that you are calm and not nervous.

example.ex: Somehow she steadied herself and murmured, 'Have you got a cigarette?'...
example.tran: 她设法让自己镇定下来，并小声问：“你有烟吗?”

example.ex: She breathed in to steady her voice.
example.tran: 她吸了一口气，好使自己的声音平静下来。

entry.def: You say 'steady on' to someone to tell them to calm down or to be careful about what they are saying.

example.tran: “万一又有人被杀呢?”——“说话注意点！”

example.ex: 'One can't live with a man like that!' — 'Steady on,' said Chris.
example.tran: “和那样的男人没法过日子！”——“冷静点，”克里斯说。

entry.tran: 有确定的情侣关系;恋爱关系稳定
entry.def: If two people are going steady, they are having a long, fairly serious romantic relationship.

example.ex: She's been going steady with Randolph for almost a year now.
example.tran: 她和伦道夫已经谈了近一年恋爱了。

auth_sentence.content: He steadied the ship, but also made visionary innovations.
auth_sentence.res_content: He steadied the ship, but also made visionary innovations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He steadied the ship, but also made visionary innovations.

auth_sentence.res_content: Hall steadied the ship, but also made visionary innovations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hall steadied the ship, but also made visionary innovations.

auth_sentence.res_content: He unfurled the sail and steadied the boom.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He unfurled the sail and steadied the boom.
